Transformers are neural networks that transform data into predictions. Unlike recurrent nets, the learned state doesn't recur. Unlike convolutional nets, they don't use kernels, padding, or strides. Transformers proved one thing: that attention is all you need.

Polymarket is a decentralized information market, harnessing the power of free markets to demystify the real-world events that matter most. You can create a full-stack dApp where events/markets are created, and a UI where users can predict outcomes. https://t.co/B9v8xUBy3g

There are also other types of marketplaces you can build. This example creates a decentralized lending exchange, including the requisite lending assets, repayments, and collateral infrastructure, enabling third parties to build applications for lending. https://t.co/akJCPXvoAk

You‚Äôll probably want to start building some actual dapps now. Let‚Äôs start with a full stack NFT marketplace. Nader Dabit has a great tutorial on how to build this using Polygon, Next.js, Tailwind, Solidity, Hardhat, Ethers.js, and IPFS. Find it here: https://t.co/kuGHgJSJAr

Then you‚Äôll want a basic web dapp to build off of. This starter kit is a boilerplate with all necessary dependencies that let's you worry less about installation and more on building Polygon dapps: https://t.co/QDMDQqWT0V

With an idea of what to build in mind, you‚Äôll want to setup your developer environment and install all the necessary dependencies. This Figment web app can be run in the browser using gitpods, it will lead you through the entire process easily: https://t.co/dd7FX688Rz

With an idea of what to build in mind, you‚Äôll want to setup your developer environment and install all the necessary dependencies. This Figment app can be run in the browser using gitpods, it will lead you through the entire process easily: https://t.co/dd7FX688Rz

Once you‚Äôve got a basic understanding of Ethereum, you‚Äôll want to learn the basics of Polygon. Blockchain school is currently offering a free course for beginners and enrollment is now open: https://t.co/NS0SsYKQa8

Polygon is Ethereum's Internet of Blockchains, so it's important to start learning Ethereum first. Questbook is a Decentralized University where learning is always free. if you want to learn the basics of Ethereum, Questbook is a great place to start: https://t.co/8gFSzDkbwk

2 types of rollups; Optimistic & Zero Knowledge. Optimistic rolls up many tx into one hash & submits to L1. It‚Äôs correct unless a user submits a fraud proof. This takes 1 week to confirm. ZK rollups submit a validity proof within the rolled up tx, so instant confirmation time.

A blockchain can only pick 2 of 3 features; decentralized, secure, or scalable. Ethereum is decentralized & secure, but not scalable. 3 solutions to this are state channels, plasma chains, and Zero Knowledge rollups. ZK rollups are the best. Polygon is the #1 ZK Rollup solution. https://t.co/gaQdIflxSr

1. Genomics - study of entire genome (DNA data)
2. Epigenomics - study of how & why DNA data changes. 
3. Transcriptomics - study of DNA data extraction (RNA)
4. Proteomics - study of  proteins/applications
5. Metabolomics - Finally, proteins degrade > metabolites (system state)

9) Ultimately, brain interfaces will enable us to merge ourselves with the Internet; an independent, sentient, autonomous digital organism far more intelligent than all of us combined. This will be the next stage of human evolution.

8) The Internet itself will start to behave like one intelligent digital organism. We won‚Äôt use individual services like Uber to book rides, or AWS to store files, we‚Äôll just use ‚Äúthe Internet‚Äù. Our requests will intelligently be routed by this decentralized nervous system.

7) Giant Language Models like GPT-3 are digital brains without limbs or organs, but when combined with decentralized tech stacks, they will become fully autonomous entities in the meta-verse, learning, making decisions, acting on them, and maintaining themselves without humans

6) NFTs aka Non fungible Tokens are a peer to peer way of assigning ownership to data, be it an image, book, or video. As the Web matures into a meta-verse, digital scarcity & digital property rights will only become more relevant to all humans, and so will NFTs.

5) We‚Äôve seen many successful Dapps in the Finance industry thus far (DeFi). Compound, Aave, and UniSwap are examples of community owned financial platforms that allow users to perform actions peer to peer for the first time, including staking, lending, borrowing, and farming.

4) Each decentralized application allows any user to be a shareholder, to own equity in the network. The value of this equity depends on the success of the community. Competitors can fork a dapps source code, but they can‚Äôt fork a community‚Äôs loyalty.

2) BTC 1st demoed p2p online money transfer. We can also use its tech to create online p2p computing, domain name registrars, file storage services, energy nets, social networks, etc. We can re-design every app to be uncensorable, open-source, owned by users, & still profitable

1) Bitcoin is the world‚Äôs first Decentralized Application. It‚Äôs an uncensorable Internet co-operative governed & owned by its users, with no central point of failure. It enables 2 computers to transmit value to each other, w/o a clearing house. What else can we do with this tech?

Aging is the loss of information over time. Time itself is embedded into our code. The genome is a hard disk, and the epigenome is a disk reader. Over time, the disk gets scratched. Deep Learning on Genomic data could help us find medicines to clean the disk, reversing aging
